recipes.title: Broccoli Potato Supreme
recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a bowl, combine the first seven ingredients; beat until smooth. Fold in half of the onions. Spread onto the bottom and up the sides of a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish, forming a shell. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.                                                                                           Cook broccoli in a small amount of water until crisp-tender; drain. Place in the potato shell. Sprinkle with cheese and remaining onions. Bake 10 minutes longer.                                        Yield: 8 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Broccoli Potato Supreme in  Taste of Home's Holiday & Celebrations CookbookAnnual 2004, p56                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (3/4 cup) equals 276 calories, 18 g fat (9 g saturated fat), 64 mg cholesterol, 605 mg sodium, 22 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 8 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a bowl, combine the first seven ingredients; beat until smooth. Fold in half of the onions.
Spread onto the bottom and up the sides of a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish, forming a shell.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.
Cook broccoli in a small amount of water until crisp-tender; drain.
Place in the potato shell. Sprinkle with cheese and remaining onions.
